Queue common interface

Any queue implementation in CDS library supports the following interface:

Stable interface

enqueue

    bool enqueue (const T &data)

Places new item with data into the queue

Returns:
true if operation success, false otherwise

dequeue

    bool dequeue (T &data)

Dequeues a value from the queue to dest.

Returns:
true if operation success, false otherwise (i.e. the queue is empty)

push

    bool push (const T &data)

Synonym for the enqueue function

pop

    bool pop (const T &data)

Synonym for the dequeue function

empty

    bool empty()

Checks if the queue is empty

clear

    void clear ()

Clears the queue in lock-free fashion.

size

    size_t size () const

Returns count of items in the queue. The value returned depends on implementation of the queue. For many implementation the item counting facility is optional and is defined by queue's template parameter TRAITS. Therefore, for the item counting it may be defined dummy object (like cds::atomics::empty_item_counter) that do nothing (it is default behavior for queue's TRAITS template parameter); in this case size() method always returns 0. In any cases, size()==0 is not equal to empty()==true. The empty method is the more reliable way to check if the queue is empty.
